Comments_List: I got better at speaking, reading, and writing in German
My ability to speak, read, and understand German improved.

It's a good layout for a course, with the units designed around cities keeping things interesting. The Essays were also a good way to measure skill. 
The tests often felt unrelated to the chapter, but I'm not really sure how that could be fixed.

The material is pretty fun and outside work is challenging but not a burden. That said, tests are all but impossible to study for, given that half of them are taken up by listening and reading activities, which are entirely dependent on you being proficient in German, not knowing a particular set of vocabulary or a piece of grammar.
I definitely think this was taught better than L1 and L2. The textbook was much better. However, more constructive criticism would've been helpful.
Yes, the course was well taught and useful
